summary: This is a mesh path fix for those who've been wanting to play the extension made by CrimsonFairy of the Tribunal Robes.
descriptionHtml:
[b]0 - Pre-download requisites:[/b]

First of all you [b]must [/b]have downloaded and installed [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/26783/?]Tribunal Robes Standalone by CrimsonFairy[/url] and at the same time the textures from Natterforme's [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/20077/?]Tribunal Robes and Masks[/url] . You can also get them from the great compilation [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/19733/?]Immersive Armors.[/url]

[b]1 - Quick description and installation.[/b]

This is a mesh path fix for those who've been wanting to play the extension made by CrimsonFairy of the Tribunal Robes in another directory that wasn't the default from steam in Program Files. Crimson originally made them for personal use, so it's fairly understood.
Basically I changed [u]every single texture path[/u] from [u]every single nitrishape in every piece of armor and colour[/u] in Nifskope. Because I drank too much coffee and wanted to play these.

"I don't know. Could be messy."

[b]2 - Thanks:

[/b]Crimsonfairy.
Natterforme.
author: CrimsonFairy and fix by Villacardo
